content.title: Lewy Body Dementia
content.summary: Progressive dementia characterized by fluctuating cognition, visual hallucinations, parkinsonism, and REM sleep behavior disorder, caused by alpha-synuclein (Lewy body) deposition
key_points: Second most common degenerative dementia after Alzheimer
Core features: fluctuating cognition, visual hallucinations, parkinsonism, REM sleep behavior disorder
Extreme sensitivity to antipsychotics - AVOID typical antipsychotics
Cholinesterase inhibitors may help cognition and hallucinations

statement.text: Progressive dementia characterized by fluctuating cognition, visual hallucinations, parkinsonism, and REM sleep behavior disorder, caused by alpha-synuclein (Lewy body) deposition
statement.formal: Lewy Body Dementia = Clinical presentation + Diagnosis + Treatment

explanation.intuition: Understanding Lewy Body Dementia is essential for clinical practice.
explanation.key_insight: Key concepts in Lewy Body Dementia management.
explanation.technical_details: Alpha-synuclein aggregates form Lewy bodies in cortical and subcortical neurons. This causes both cognitive symptoms (cortical involvement) and parkinsonism (substantia nigra involvement). Cholinergic deficit more severe than in Alzheimer.

pathophysiology.mechanism: Alpha-synuclein aggregates form Lewy bodies in cortical and subcortical neurons. This causes both cognitive symptoms (cortical involvement) and parkinsonism (substantia nigra involvement). Cholinergic deficit more severe than in Alzheimer.
etiologies: Risk factors similar to Parkinson disease

diagnostic_criteria.core_features: Fluctuating cognition, visual hallucinations, REM sleep behavior disorder, parkinsonism

treatment_options.cholinesterase_inhibitors: Donepezil, rivastigmine - may help cognition and hallucinations
treatment_options.hallucinations: Quetiapine or clozapine if needed (avoid typical antipsychotics)
